meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being regarded or treated as more important than others.
meanings.sent1: In our family, education is one of our top priorities.
meanings.sent2: She always puts her health as her number one priority.
meanings.sent3: His love for pizza is a funny priority in his life.
meanings.sent4: Her priorities shine like bright stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The safety of her children is her unwavering priority.

meanings.definition: A thing that is regarded as more important than others.
meanings.sent1: For him, his job is his main priority.
meanings.sent2: The safety of the passengers is the pilot's top priority.
meanings.sent3: His phone became his unexpected priority during the trip.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was his priority among all the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The rescue team made saving lives their ultimate priority.

meanings.definition: The right to precede others in order, rank, privilege, etc.
meanings.sent1: The CEO's priority is to make important decisions for the company.
meanings.sent2: In the royal family, the prince has the priority to the throne.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed priority over the dog's bed.
meanings.sent4: The champion earned priority in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The keyholder has priority access to all rooms in the building.
